meanings.definition: To reduce to small particles by rubbing against a rough surface.
meanings.sent1: I grate the cheese for the pizza on the rough tool.
meanings.sent2: She used a grater to grate the carrots for the salad.
meanings.sent3: The sound of the grater grating against the cheese made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rough wind seemed to grate against the old house, wearing it down over time.
meanings.sent5: The chef's skilled hands grated the lemon zest with precision.

meanings.definition: A framework of metal bars used as a partition or guard.
meanings.sent1: The grate on the window kept the birds from entering the house.
meanings.sent2: The metal grate on the floor allowed for ventilation in the basement.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to climb the grate, thinking it was a ladder.
meanings.sent4: The grate in the fireplace glowed red with the heat of the burning logs.
meanings.sent5: The grate on the drain prevented any large objects from falling through.

meanings.sent1: The constant noise from the construction site began to grate on my nerves.
meanings.sent2: Her high-pitched voice started to grate on his ears after a while.
meanings.sent3: The repetitive music began to grate on the audience's patience.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic noise seemed to grate against the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent5: The way he chewed his food loudly would grate on anyone's patience.
